subject: Marketing
title: Content Decay and Refresh
description: A fast breakdown of Content Decay and Refresh for builders.

hook.text: A blog post that ranked number one for two years suddenly drops to page three. Content decays.

buildup.text: Search engines favor fresh, accurate content. Outdated pages lose rankings over time.

discovery.text: Updating old content is often more effective than creating new content from scratch.

twist.text: HubSpot increased traffic 106% on old posts just by updating statistics and examples.

climax.text: A content refresh strategy turns a decaying library into an ever-improving asset.

punchline.text: Don't just publish. Maintain and improve.

quiz.question: Why is refreshing old content often more effective than creating new content?
options: Updated content regains rankings faster than new pages earn them
Old URLs are always ranked higher by search engines
New content is penalized for the first six months
